Row.Text: Blind Monk
A blind monk arrives at our court, seeking to propagate their faith. They speak in riddles, and claim to know a truer path to our religion than that currently taught by our clerics.
We welcome what insights they might have.
This blind fool knows nothing. Turn him away.
Receive a Missionary with +2 Sight.
We have turned away a Blink Monk professing to know a truer path to our religion.
We have invited a Blink Monk professing to know a truer path to our religion.
Influx of Migrants
An influx of migrants are flooding from across the border. Their threat to our culture is bringing unease to our people.
We welcome them into our realm.
Turn them away and strengthen our borders.
{1_Yield} and the city gains +1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
The city begins celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 15 turns.
Migrants have been accepted into {2_CityDesc}.
Migrants have been turned away from {2_CityDesc}.
{3_LeaderName} of {1_CivName} has welcomed an influx of migrants into his country.
{3_LeaderName} of {1_CivName} has dispelled an influx of migrants into his country.
City of Zion
The Council of Fifty has lauded our new conquest. They see it as place to cultivate Zion and the new Jerusalem, where all shall live in wait until the days of the Second Coming.
Then it must be done.
This city is unsuitable.
The city becomes your new Capital, and is re-named to Zion. A [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age begins.
No effect.
We have declared {2_CityDesc} to be the heralded Zion.
We have {2_CityDesc} as a candidate for Zion.
{3_LeaderName} of {1_CivName} has declared their new Capital at Zion.
Wagon Trains
Wagon trains seeking to settle within our lands have appeared along our borders. However, we do not know if they are friend or foe, and they might yet pose a threat to us.
We welcome them. We trust in God.
They cannot be trusted.
50% chance the city gains +1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population, otherwise, Barbarians spawn near the city.
20% chance that Barbarians spawn near the city.
Wagon trains have been welcomed into {1_CityDesc}.
Wagon trains have been welcomed into {1_CityDesc}. Alas! They were no friends to us!
Suspicious wagon trains have been turned away from {1_CityDesc}.
Circus Maximus
An adversary has become popular for their racing complex at the Via Appia. Our advisors have suggested that, in response, we should expand the seating available at the Circus Maximus.
A waste of coin.
Yes, expand the seating.
No effect.
{1_Yield} and the city gains +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
The seating in the Circus Maximus in {2_CityDesc} has been expanded.
Pagan Dissenters
Wretched villains of the old faith have renegaded on their committment to peace and tolerance. They march upon us![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Three Barbarian Units appear near the city.
Cousin the Need
One of our cousins is facing popular protests against him in his home country. He requests sancutary until the matter is resolved.
Yes, we cannot refuse family.
No, the people would despise us.
+{3_Num} [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance Sentiment and +{2_Num}.
{1_Num} [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points and the Capital begins celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 15 turns.
We have pledged to the security of our cousin in need, although the people have not welcomed him with the same enthusiasm.
We have treacherously denied our cousin in their time of need. Now let's murder some kittens.
Foreign Connections
Ministers have suggested that we change our family name, which bears too much likeness to one of our enemies.
Yes, we shall re-christian ourselves the House of Windsor.
No, we cannot abandon our heritage.
{1_Num} and all Cities begin celebrating [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] 'We Love the King Day' for 5 turns.
We have formally re-named our dynasty to the House of Windsor.
We have dismissed concerns over the use of our family name.
{3_LeaderName} of {1_CivName} has declared himself head of the House of Windsor, distancing himself from one of his relatives.
